alert.note: Alert for Coal; Hughes; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 08 at 10:21AM CDT until June 08 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Pottawatomie County in central Oklahoma... Pontotoc County in east central Oklahoma... Southwestern Seminole County in east central Oklahoma... Western Coal County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southwestern Hughes County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 130 PM CDT. * At 1021 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ada, Konawa, Byng, Allen, Stonewall, Tupelo, Francis, Fitzhugh, St. Louis, Centrahoma, Fittstown, Vanoss, Clarita and Jesse. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
